solution_line_template: The mother is {mother_current_age} years old now, so {years_ago} years ago she was {mother_current_age}-{years_ago}=<<{mother_current_age}-{years_ago}={mother_age_five_years_ago}>>{mother_age_five_years_ago} years old

At that time the daughter's age was half hers so the daughter was {mother_age_five_years_ago}/{half_divisor}=<<{mother_age_five_years_ago}/{half_divisor}={daughter_age_five_years_ago}>>{daughter_age_five_years_ago} years old
Now ({years_ago} years after that time) the daughter is {daughter_age_five_years_ago}+{years_ago}={daughter_current_age} years old

In {years_in_future} years, the daughter will be {daughter_current_age}+{years_in_future}=<<{daughter_current_age}+{years_in_future}={daughter_age_in_three_years}>>{daughter_age_in_three_years} years old
